Yep. It is dumb. The whole rework is just something we'd be better off without IMO. It feels like it was thrown together on whim using bits and pieces stolen from wrestling, Shen, Vi and a few other places. There's nothing original, nothing to make new Galio distinct.
So you're saying that Riot can't give champions some similar looking abilities? I mean look at Veigar and Thresh. I distinctly remember one of their abilities that work almost exactly the same.

Ummm they both have a box but the shape and mechanics of the boxes are so vastly different they're really not similar.
They shouldn't however be giving champs abilities that just feel like they belong on another champ or are just remodeled versions of a previous ability.

But that's exactly what Thresh and Veigar's is like. One is just a remodeled version of the other. Plus there are plenty of other champions that have similar working abilities like Yasuo and Janna for example. They both have a tornado that does the exact same thing. 
Garen and Darius both a have a dunk, Darius's just does more damage while Garen's silences them. Ivern basically has {{summoner:32}} as one of his abilities. 
Morgana, Lux, Zyra, etc. all have a skill shot snare that works exactly the same only with different animations and scales of damage.
Xin Zhao and Janna's ultimates work almost the same except Janna heals while Xin does damage.

Plus when there are now 134 champions in LoL, you should expect that it begins to become more difficult for unique concepts and mechanics to show themselves.

Veigar's is a ranged, basic skill, no-damage version that feeds his passive. Thresh's is different in all those respects. And they only have one similar ability between them. And the similar ability isn't Veigar's ult, whereas it's ults that are directly near-same between Galio and Shen, with Shen having the clearly overall better version and better kit overall, making Galio simply redundant. Janna's WW has a chargeup and doesn't interact with her ult. Yasuo's requires hits on enemies instead and is used to set up his ult. Morgana's 3 year root is an abomination in and of itself so don't even get me started there. Zyra's is much slower and works very differently due to the usage with her plants. Plus most champions have at least 2 things that really set them apart from any other champion. Galio has nothing like that left except the taunt itself, and he used to have several more things which they outright replaced with copycat abilities. That's bad rework design.

It also was designed by solcrushed who apparently has a thing for designing Disney champs. First Taliyah the Disney princess, now Galio is replaced with the Iron Giant, I don't even pay attention to champs he designs or updates anymore.

At least Taliyah has a creative ult and passive, so I can accept her. New Galio is completely and utterly uninspired and just doesn't belong in League of Legends. The old Galio was much better and did occupy a worthwhile niche, making it straight up better, making a total revert on this entire VGU the way to go. We were clearly better off before. They should place an absolute ban on champion concepts that can't physically fit, size-wise, in the Summoner's Rift style of gameplay we actually have in League of Legends. Any such characters have to be relegated to non-champions that appear in non-game media. This colossus just doesn't work. ANY colossus just would not work as a champion unless they either majorly redesign the game engine and/or put some kind of explanation in the lore as to why a mountain-sized champion is now at best still less than twice the height of a perfectly ordinary man. Did Teemo permanently shrink-ray Galio at some point?

I am extremely unhappy with the rework and want old Galio back. The new kit is overly generic and feels like a mere redundant hybrid of existing champions rather than a unique champion in its own right. Not to mention, making him a "colossus" when you can't hope to convey even a fraction of that size in-game is just silly. He doesn't fight even remotely like a colossus, he still fights like a man-sized statue - just a more boring one than he used to be.
So you have a problem with Galio's in-game size but not Malphite? Malphite's lore size is bigger than Galio.

He simply didn't mention Malphite.  The fact is that abnormally large "champions" would not fight the same way that regular-sized champions would, and it's absurd to create a back story for a champion that makes them huge and then put them in a scenario where they're fighting comparatively tiny opponents as if they were the same size.

And it's also absurd to introduce a new champion and give him the name of a different champion that is being removed from the game.

You don't have in-game models for accurate size. Look at any moba or rts, even red and blue buff are a lot bigger than in-game model would have you believe. Anyway, the problem seems to lie in his animations not his model size, because if you have "real scale" models it looks silly.
Which means it doesn't make sense to create characters that are stupidly huge and them put them in the context of fighting regular-sized champions.
Why limit creativity that way?

Limits can actually be a wonderful thing for creativity.  Sticking fictional characters in situations that don't make sense is, in fact, not creative.  If anything, it's lazy.  Right now we don't have any explanation for how or why characters of vastly different sizes would be fighting each other or how it would make sense.  Creativity, if exercised, would produce an explanation for that.
Don't forget chogath and nautilus size as well
Meanwhile, Aurelion Sol looks down from the heavens and wonders what all the puny mortals are in a fuss about.

I think the more important part is that in the splash Galio is portrayed as a towering existence, about 15 times the size of the nearby people. Think about that, because that would mean that all the champions in league are towering existences when looking at there in-game model. So Lulu, shes actually a giant, oh and lux, even bigger. To put it into scale. Lulu would be about 7-8 times the size, Lux 12-13, and Aatrox with one of the tallest if not the tallest in-game model stands at a staggering 16 times the size of the near by people. Even the minions are at least 3 times the size of the people. So to summarize they really are league of _LEGEND_. Because they are so insainly large existence battling it out for and against the rest of us tiny existences. And to make it even more over the top you have summoners who instructs these Legends. So I have to ask, what are we? We give orders/instructions to beings that are basically god like existences, so what is the most powerful existence in the game, the summoner. With varying strengths and skills we command an god like (Legendary) existence, so this raises a question. If the champions we instruct are some god like existence, what does that make us?
